page.title: 12E.Horsley S. Life styles.
page.content: This is a wealthy area where the houses are in general large individual centrally heated and set in large grounds. Most households have 2 cars, the area lacking a large shopping centre & with minimal public trans- port. There is a small estate on the main road built by the Council & rent- ed to lower income families. There are flats over the shops in Bishopsmead Parade & sheltered housing for the elderly nearby. All the area is serv- ed by a postman & an electric float delivers milk daily. Some owners of the large houses are businessmen working abroad who rent their houses to people from other countries, especially Americans, who are working in England. They are generally manag- ed by estate agents who collect rent, organise repairs and arrange for the upkeep of the house and garden.
